basics.name: Ksenia Gulyaeva
basics.label: Full-Stack Developer
basics.summary:
A fast-learning Web Developer with a real passion for coding, solving problems and getting things done, who has experience developing React and Vue.js web applications with Node.js backend with PostgreSQL and Neo4j as a DB, as well as working with vanilla JavaScript and TypeScript.
Open to opportunities to learn new technologies and pick up new backend/mobile languages.
I have a spouse visa which allows me to work in the Netherlands without restrictions.

work.name: Cimpress Technology
work.summary: Cimpress Technology is a company building a mass customisation b2b platform.
highlights: Developing and refactoring a TypeScript Node.js and React logistics application used by factory logistics managers.

work.name: ABN AMRO
work.summary: ABN Amro is the third-largest bank in the Netherlands. I was working on an internal governance tool that supports company leadership with data for decision-making by providing data insights.
highlights: Onboarding new data sources and integrating them into the platform
Improving the stability of the end-to-end tests by implementing industry best practices
Cross-team collaboration on shared libraries development
Implementing features involving changes within the frontend, backend and database (Neo4j)

work.name: Self-employed
work.summary: After finishing Codaisseur, I worked 30+ hours a week on my projects using the technologies I learned and the new ones I wanted or needed to use.
highlights:
https://erudit.ksinia.net
Erudite: Scrabble-like mobile-friendly online multiplayer word game, up to 8 players in a room.
My most complex personal project to date, which is used daily by a dozen people. During the project's lifetime, I've learned many things about development, data schema migrations, project maintenance, customer interactions and prioritising bugfixes and features development GitHub usage.

https://scrolling-platformer.netlify.app
Johny Flame: 2D side-scrolling platform game I've created to learn the Phaser game framework and try out how hard it would be to create a platformer on a web page.
New technologies used: TypeScript, Phaser, Parcel

https://stats.radio-t.com/rlb/
RLB-stats: pure JS frontend for podcast download analytics project written in Go. I created a web page that supports four different JS chart libraries to visualise the same data in different ways.
New libraries used: TauCharts, ECharts, AnyCharts, ApexCharts

https://melodic-dictation.netlify.app
Melodic Dictation: full-stack app for ear training by writing melodic dictations, e.g. writing down notes for music you hear.
New libraries used: abcjs, web-midi-player

https://game31.netlify.app
Thirty-One online multiplayer card game, mobile-friendly. It was created in collaboration with a teammate.
New technologies used: Node.js, React, Redux, Material-UI, Express.js, Sequelize

work.name: Codaisseur
work.summary:
The immersive 11-week on-site 40 hours a week course on full-stack development.
Project workflow includes code reviews and quality assessments, standard practices such as product development, UX design, and domain modelling, working together in teams using tools like VSCode, Git, Github, and Slack.
highlights: Got 100% grades for every assignment during the course
Over my time there, I've created and published numerous projects in my GitHub account: https://github.com/ksinia/

work.name: CJ VFX (visual effects studio)
work.summary: My first programming job was in a visual effects studio supporting internal teams' needs. I had to give it up because of relocation to Amsterdam.
highlights: Created backup/recovery script for corporate files library and visual interface for its configuration in PyQT
Started the design and implementation of the VFX render manager interface

work.name: Tesler Electronics, Paolo Conte, Revontuli Toys OY
work.summary: Before switching to Software Development, I've been working in procurement. I searched for suppliers in China, negotiated purchasing prices and other conditions with them, localised product packaging and manuals, controlled the orders from placement until delivery.

education.institution: Codaisseur Academy for Full-Stack Web Development

courses: Diving into Python, coursework: sockets client-server application using asyncio
Programming for Everybody (Getting Started with Python)
Chinese language internship at Peking University in 2005

publications.name: Planet Parade game for Android
publications.summary: Android port of the iOS game

skills.name: Soft skills
keywords: Participating in open-source projects with distributed teams
